title: What are the best tools for augmented reality development? - Quora

response.answer_text: Augmented Reality is really booming, and with Apple’s goal to make Augmented Reality (AR) mainstream with their announcement of the toolkit - ARKit in the summer 2017, all developers now are on the hunt to find the best AR tools to create the next big AR app. We have so many AR tools out there, and all of them can be the best for your development - all depends on what you are used to work and create app or games.  These are some of the tools that can really help you in achieving your goals with developing AR experiences: ARKit With online resources becoming increasingly and progressively available to help game and app creators tap the power of ARKit. It recognizes the surrounding around you, including objects an planes, and then allows you to actually place your objects in that surrounding (environment), manipulate them and keep track of them as the device (iPhone, iPad) moves. Have you wondered yourself on “how can i create a best selling Augmented Reality game using ARKit”? The answer is HERE.  Since its announcement, ARKit has made AR game and app development easier than ever! Vuforia Vuforia is an Augmented Reality SDK (Software Development Kit) for mobile devices that set up and enables the creation of AR apps. It uses Computer Vision technology in order to recognize and track planar images (pictures) and simple 3D objects, such as boxes, in actual time (real-time). The Vuforia SDK supports a variety of 3D and 2D target.  Kudan Kudan is empowering next-gen Augmented Reality devices & apps. Kudan Augmented Reality is the only SDK available with marker and markeless operation and 2D/3D rendering in a single package as well. It offers great image recognition, lightning-fast development speed, low memory footprint, and no limit on number of markers. EasyAR EasyAR is a free and easy to use alternative to Vuforia. In order to start your work with EasyAR, you have to register an account and to generate and produce the plugin’s key of your Bundle ID. This tool, EasyAR, is quite easy to integrate. Examples and documentation are intuitively understandable. ARToolKit ARToolKit is an open-source computer library for creation and development of strong AR apps that overlay virtual imagery on the real world. Wikitude Wikitude is a mobile AR tech provider - that is focused on providing location-based AR experiences and practices through the Wikitude World Browser App.

Well AR is so much in the business game right now and it has for sure come to stay and be in the mainstream of tech world. We must agree on how much easier AR has made our lives. Now, the best tools for AR development are: Vuforia  Its the most popular sdk used for AR development. It works for following platforms: Android,iOS,Universal Windows Platform, andUnity Editor.You can use it for free, but the consequences are watermarks and very limited features. However, you can buy the paid subscription for professional uses. Paid Vuforia offers large range of functions for AR development. ARKit  This AR development sdk was created specifically for iOS by Apple. Therefore, works on: iOS 11 or newerThis could be the best SDK you can ever find if you target the Apple platforms to launch your AR app. ARCore  ARCore is more like Google’s a response to ARKit. If works for following platforms: Android 7.0+, andiOS 11+Unlike ARKit, Google’s ARCore supports AR development on both Android and iOS. Using this SDK allows tracking the phone’s motion and its position relative to the surrounding objects. AR has come a very long way, it can do much more than placing the furniture virtually in your living room. Related Resource : Augmented Reality Is Altering The Real Estate Landscape These are not the only ones that can help you develop an AR application. There are many more like WikiTude and MaxST, the ones I have mentioned are the widely used SDKs for AR development. Thanks. Hope it helps.
